abstract: A case now pending against Bank of America involving hedge fund fraud recalls the go-go years of the late 1960s, when hot mutual funds captured the imagination of investors, The New York Times’s Floyd Norris writes in his latest High & Low Finance column.
snippet: A case now pending against Bank of America involving hedge fund fraud recalls the go-go years of the late 1960s, when hot mutual funds captured the imagination of investors, The New York Times’s Floyd Norris writes in his latest High & Low Finance...
lead_paragraph: It’s been four decades since the go-go years of the late 1960s, when hot mutual funds captured the imagination of investors by reporting performance that was too good to be true.
